intro: Ranunculus orientalis var. heterophylla, commonly known as the Persian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers with five to eight petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features palmate leaves that are deeply divided. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The varietal name *heterophylla* refers to the variation in leaf shape, which can differ depending on environmental conditions.
